article.headline: Boise State 87, Idaho State 78
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP) -- Jermaine Blackburn scored 17 points to lead Boise State to an 87-78 victory over Idaho State Wednesday night. It was the Broncos' (5-1) eighth consecutive victory over the Bengals (3-4). In the second half, BSU led but as much as 14 points before ISU made a 23-7 run to cut the Broncos' lead to 66-64. That was as close as the Bengals got. ISU's Marquis Poole consistently drove to the basket in the second half, scoring 14 of his game and career-high 25 points. Scott Henry also had 18 points for Idaho State. The Broncos had five players in double figures and had a 46-32 rebound edge. Bryan Defares had 14, Coby Karl had 11 with Aaron Haynes and Jason Ellis adding ten each. BSU jumped to a 9-0 lead and had it as high as 25-13 before the Bengals (3-4) got rolling, outscoring Boise State 17-5 to take a 32-30 lead with 6:53 left in the first half. The Broncos made a 13-3 run and led 49-40 at the half.
